title: [Feature Request] Allow connections to behave as folders.
author: mmetully
body_snippet: Because virtual hosts can contain virtual machines, it would be nice to be able to treat a connection as a folder and contain other connections.

iterations.description: The request does not define required behavior for inheritance, drag/drop, open-session actions, and serialization when a connection also contains children.
Valid feature request to allow hierarchical organization where parent nodes are also connectable endpoints (e.g., a gateway server containing backend servers).

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: I will need to think about this a bit. This is sort of how it is implemented already, but there are features that would need to be re-thought-through if connections can directly contain other connections.

notes:
AI triage (codex): The request does not define required behavior for inheritance, drag/drop, open-session actions, and serialization when a connection also contains children.
Approach: Confirm exact UX and data-model rules for connection-as-folder nodes, then refactor containment logic and update tree interaction handling accordingly.
AI triage (gemini): Valid feature request to allow hierarchical organization where parent nodes are also connectable endpoints (e.g., a gateway server containing backend servers).
Approach: Update ConnectionInitiator to attempt connection on ContainerInfo if hostname is present; expose connection properties for Containers in UI; adjust tree click behavior.
